intro: Bertya tasmanica, commonly known as the Tasmanian bertya, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and shrubs. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with dense, evergreen foliage. Its flowers are small and usually pink or white, appearing in clusters. Bertya tasmanica is adapted to the moist, acidic soils of its native habitat.
